ygData.subject: Re: FW: [EQ_SMITHS] Studs and studded leather armor...
ygData.msgSnippet: ahah!!  I just knew there had to be a market for the stuff. Okay, are there any smiths on the Tunare server who would like to team up with a Tailor?  I am a
ygData.messageBody:
ahah!! I just knew there had to be a market for the stuff.

Okay, are there any smiths on the Tunare server who would like to team up
with a Tailor? I am a very skilled tailor, but have not had the training
points or money to invest in smithing yet. Please let me know if you are
interested.

On a second note, I am also very skilled in pottery, so can be of help
making ceramic linings if you are practicing your skill in smithing with
items that require those and do not wish to invest in the pottery
proficiency.


Thanks,

Tanaltuset, Halfling Rogue, Tunare server





> A freind of mine is a Ranger/Tailor and they have had extensive
> talks about
> studed/reenforced on the Ranger mailing list he is on, He and I
> are also in
> bussiness selling the stuff in the Kelethin area (I supply the studs, we
> both go kill the puma's for the pelts, and he makes the armour)
> from what I
> have been told the ac is a little better on some pieces of armour, where
> studed and reinforced become usefull is in their absourbtion. as
> an example
> say in leather you get hit for 8 points of dammage the exact same hit in
> studed armour would do 6 damm and 4 damm in reinforced. This of course is
> just an example of the numbers which will probally vary....
> because of this
> extra absourbtion and better AC studed/reinforced is well worth it for the
> people who can't use better.
